message.content:
cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the Traveling Salesman Problem (TSP) in a metric space, which is a classic problem in computer science and optimization. The focus is on the $s$-$t$-path TSP, which is a variant of the TSP where the goal is to find a path from $s$ to $t$ that visits all the other nodes in the graph. This problem is closely related to graph theory, combinatorial optimization, and approximation algorithms, which are all covered by the above sub-categories. Specifically, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.CG (Computational Geometry) are relevant due to the use of LP relaxation and spanning trees. cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) and cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) are relevant due to the combinatorial nature of the problem and the approximation algorithm. Finally, cs.CC (Computational Complexity) is relevant due to the analysis of the approximation ratio.
